title: Tesla Will Open Its Charging Network to G.M.’s Electric Vehicles
description: The electric car company, which operates the country’s most extensive charging network, struck a similar deal with Ford Motor recently.

title: After a Rocky Year, Zuckerberg Lays Out Meta’s Road Map to Employees
description: In an internal all-hands meeting, the chief executive explained his plans for artificial intelligence, the metaverse and rebooting Meta’s culture.

title: Louisiana Passes Bill That Would Require Parental Consent for Kids’ Online Accounts
description: The measure would allow parents to cancel the contracts underlying their children’s accounts on sites like TikTok, Instagram, Roblox and YouTube.

title: AirNow and Other Apps to Help You Track Air Quality Near You
description: Air quality levels have been a source of intense interest this week. There are a number of ways to keep track of them on your phone.

title: Una primera prueba del Vision Pro de Apple
description: Tuve en mis manos el nuevo visor de alta tecnología que me dejó impresionado y asustado. ¿Para qué lo necesitamos?

title: Hey, Alexa, What Should Students Learn About A.I.?
description: While schools debate what to teach students about powerful new A.I. tools, tech giants, universities and nonprofits are intervening with free lessons.

title: Khan Academy’s AI Tutor Bot Aims to Reshape Learning
description: Proponents see the tools as a way to automatically customize academic support. They could also make children test subjects for A.I. experiments.

title: Does CNN’s Turmoil Mean There’s No Room on Cable for Independent News?
description: Chris Licht’s tenure illuminated how increasingly hard it can be to find success on the divided cable news dial.

title: New York Nico Celebrates the City’s Colorful Side
description: Nicolas Heller, better known online as New York Nico, has developed a following in part by not being the star of his own feeds.

title: Not Just Math Quizzes: Khan Academy’s Tutoring Bot Offers Playful Features
description: The new, A.I.-assisted Khanmigo allows students to chat with simulated historical figures or co-write stories with the software.
